com.futuresailors.battleships.controller

Class PlaceShipsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.futuresailors.battleships.controller.PlaceShipsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class PlaceShipsController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller
    This controller adds a PlaceShipsPanel to the window and is used to allow users to choose the tiles they wish to place their ships in.
    Author:
    Michael Conroy

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlaceShipsController

        public PlaceShipsController(Grid grid,
                            Ship[] ships,
                            GameTypeController controller,
                            javax.swing.JFrame window)
        Creates the panel, adds it to the window and adds the listener.
        Parameters:
        grid - - The player's grid.
        ships - - The ships that need to be placed.
        controller - - The parent controller of this controller which it will return to once complete.
        window - - The JFrame that the placeshipspanel should be drawn on.

    • Method Detail

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.Point pos)
        Called by the listener to tell the mouse has been clicked. If all the ships have been placed then the user can click anywhere and move onto the actual gameplay itself. If the ships haven't been placed it will check whether the position clicked in is a valid tile to place a ship and if so it will place it, move onto the next ship, and update the view.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface Controller
        Parameters:
        pos - - Position the mouse was clicked.

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.Point pos)
        Called by the listener when the mouse is moved. Detects the state of the board and if all the ships haven't been placed it will display what tiles the ship will take up if the user clicks to place it.
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface Controller
        Parameters:
        pos - - Position the mouse has moved to.

      • returnToMenu

        public void returnToMenu()
        Returns the user to the Main Menu by passing creating a new MainMenuController and calling the showMenu method.
        Specified by:
        returnToMenu in interface Controller
